description: Episode of Series "The Facts for Life". Looks at the different ways in which infections - mainly bacteria, (causing, for example, dental caries, sore throats, typhoid fever and whooping cough) and viruses (causing the common cold, measles, small pox and polio) can invade the body, and the way in which they can be treated, controlled or prevented.
